task.title: Configuring the master host as a ZooKeeper node

context.p: This procedure configures the master host as a member of the ZooKeeper ensemble.
context.note: For accuracy, this procedure constructs configuration variables in the shell and appends them to /etc/default/serviced. The last step is to move the variables from the end of the file to more appropriate locations.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Create a variable for each host to include in the ZooKeeper ensemble.
step.info: The variables are used in subsequent steps.

info.note: Define the variables identically on the master host and on each resource pool host.

stepxmp.p: Replace Master-Host-IP with the IP address of the master host, and replace Pool-Host-A-IP and Pool-Host-B-IP with the IP addresses of the resource pool hosts to include in the ensemble:

info.note: ZooKeeper requires IP addresses for ensemble configuration.

step.cmd: Set the ZooKeeper node ID to 1.
Specify the nodes in the ZooKeeper ensemble.
step.stepxmp: You may copy the following text and paste it in your console: echo "SERVICED_ZK=${node1}:2181,${node2}:2181,${node3}:2181" \ >> /etc/default/serviced

step.cmd: Specify the nodes in the ZooKeeper quorum.
step.info: ZooKeeper requires a unique quorum definition for each node in its ensemble. To achieve this, replace the IP address of the current node with 0.0.0.0.
step.stepxmp: You may copy the following of text and paste it in your console: q1="1@0.0.0.0:2888:3888" q2="2@${node2}:2888:3888" q3="3@${node3}:2888:3888" echo "SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_QUORUM=${q1},${q2},${q3}" \ >> /etc/default/serviced

substep.cmd: Navigate to the end of the file, and cut the line that contains the SERVICED_ZK variable declaration at that location.
substep.info: The value of this declaration specifies 3 hosts.

substep.cmd: Locate the SERVICED_ZK variable near the beginning of the file, and then delete the line it is on.
substep.info: The value of this declaration is just the master host.

substep.cmd: Paste the SERVICED_ZK variable declaration from the end of the file in the location of the just-deleted declaration.
Navigate to the end of the file, and cut the line that contains the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_ID variable declaration at that location.
Locate the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_ID variable near the end of the file, and then delete the line it is on.
Paste the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_ID variable declaration from the end of the file in the location of the just-deleted declaration.
Navigate to the end of the file, and cut the line that contains the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_QUORUM variable declaration at that location.
Locate the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_QUORUM variable near the end of the file, and then delete the line it is on.
Paste the SERVICED_ISVCS_ZOOKEEPER_QUORUM variable declaration from the end of the file in the location of the just-deleted declaration.
Save the file, and then close the text editor.
